page.title: 08Coombe Hill Canal:History.
page.content: The Canal was built in the 1830's. It was first used to transport coal to Cheltenham.It was eventually closed down as trains were used instead of the barges,towards the end of the 19 century.The Canal continued to decline and was drained in the 1950's because it flooded.It became very overgrown , a haven for wildlife.Schools visited it regularly. In 1952 Mr.Alan Pitkin moved to the area + tried to organise the restoration of the Canal.He planned to run pleasure and educational trips.A Trust was set up to pay for the work.However,the plan failed and in June 1985 the Canal was bought by the Gloucester Conservationists Society.
